Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) are highly efficient in terms of converting hydrogen's chemical energy into electrical energy through electrochemical reactions and for generating power in the range of several kW to several tens of kW. A variable flow ejector equipped with an adjustable recirculating flow rate mechanism was designed for this investigation.
Titulo: Evaluation of a variable flow ejector for anode gas circulation in a 50-kW class SOFC

Sentencas: A prototype was manufactured to control the circulation of anode exhaust gas for a 50-kW class SOFC system.
Titulo: Evaluation of a variable flow ejector for anode gas circulation in a 50-kW class SOFC

Sentencas: The ejector performance was evaluated using SOFC simulator equipment that simulated the pressure and temperature environment of a 50-kW SOFC system.
Titulo: Evaluation of a variable flow ejector for anode gas circulation in a 50-kW class SOFC

Sentencas: In the heating simulation experiment, the mass flow rate ratio of the driving gas to the suction gas could be controlled from 3.7 to 5.4 under conditions simulating 100% of the rated load operation and from 4 to 7.5 when simulating 30%-50% of the partial load conditions.
Titulo: Evaluation of a variable flow ejector for anode gas circulation in a 50-kW class SOFC

Sentencas: A simple heat transfer model for the motive nozzle was used in the ejector analysis, and issues for improving the ejector recirculation performance in the high-temperature field were identified.
Titulo: Evaluation of a variable flow ejector for anode gas circulation in a 50-kW class SOFC
